Make logic more concise and get rid of a couple of helper methods
Use a 'Storage' interface for Preferences; refactor some widget utility methods from UserData to AndroidWidgetRepository and use a 'WidgetRepository' interface for this too

Tidy

Refactor more non-activity specific portfolio domain logic into PorfolioStockRepository

Fix bug where passing quotes by reference was causing havoc
Move stock quote repo cache serialization logic to stock quote repo instead of the individual stocks.  The individual stocks do not have the responsiblity of persisting themselves
Fix bug where default widget preferences were not getting applied on Configure

Factor out AlarmManager logic into its own class; Begin factoring out widget view logic into WidgetView; Rename and simplify many methods in WidgetProviderBase (small, focused, self-documenting methods)
Factor constants into Enums where possible; factor out widget colors into WidgetColors class
Remove privately used method from WidgetRepository interface;  rename delWidgetId to delWidget

Create WidgetStock class to supply widget values needed for display

Pass strongly typed arguments with AsyncTask rather than casting parameters;  Split doInBackground using onPostExecute; Fix iteration bug in FxChangeRepository; Ensure WidgetStock can be setup when there are no details saved in the portfolio; Tidy manifest
Ensure absolute change view is enabled on widget configure, rather than only after preferences has been loaded the first time
Simplify adding and removing widgetIds
Tidying

Fix bug when displaying portfolio: was referencing a class variable that was not initialized; fix bug when changing views: was not checking for a non-empty portfolio correctly
Add links to help resource online (http://niteshpatel.github.io/ministocks/help.html, and http://niteshpatel.github.io/ministocks/faq.html)
Create WidgetRow class to manage data for each stock widget row; some other minor renames and moving around

Fix bug with non-available Fx repo causing crash (now fails gracefully); Fixed issue with deleting widgets (List.remove uses location unless the argument is an object, so now we cast to Integer to force the usage of the overload)
